qas.question: When did Prince Charles write to Burke?
How many foreign supporters did Burke think a French royalist was worth?
What did Burke see as proof of the importance of French royalists?
What country was Prince Charles part of the ruling family of?
In what writing did Burke comment about the importance of La Vendee?

answers.text: Remarks on the Policy of the Allies with Respect to France

qas.question: Who thought Burke was not taking the uprising seriously?
How many foreigners did Burke say twenty Frenchman were worth?
What region did Prince Charles use to back up his points?
When did Burke enter His Majesty's Service?
Who told Burke Frenchman were worth more than foreigners?

context: Burke believed <b5_0>the Government<b5_0/> was not taking the uprising seriously enough, a view reinforced by a letter he had received from the <b9_0>Prince Charles of <a3_0>France<b9_0/><a3_0/> (S.A.R. le comte d'Artois), dated <a0_0>23 October<a0_0/>, requesting that he intercede on behalf of the royalists to the Government. Burke was forced to reply on <b8_0>6 November<b8_0/>: "I am not in His Majesty's Service; or at all consulted in his Affairs". Burke published his <a4_0>Remarks on the Policy of the Allies with Respect to France<a4_0/>, begun in October, where he said: "I am sure every thing has shewn us that in this war with France, <b6_0>one<b6_0/> Frenchman is worth <a1_0>twenty<a1_0/> foreigners. <a2_0><b7_0>La Vendée<b7_0/><a2_0/> is a proof of this".
